articles.author: Maayan Lubell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: It was not immediately clear if the hostage rescue and the deadly Israeli assault were part of the same operation but both took place in al-Nuseirat, an often embattled area in the eight-month-old war between Israel and Gaza's ruling Hamas.
articles.title: Israel rescues four hostages in Gaza; Palestinians say 50 dead in Israeli assault

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israel's centrist war cabinet minister Benny Gantz is scheduled to give a speech later on Saturday in which he is widely expected to announce his resignation from Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's emergency government.
articles.title: Israel's war cabinet minister Gantz expected to quit Netanyahu government

articles.author: Jeff Mason, Michel Rose
articles.description: Fresh from commemorating the 80th anniversary of D-Day, French President Emmanuel Macron will host U.S. President Joe Biden on Saturday for a state visit marked by pomp and a parade as well as talks on trade, Israel and Ukraine.
articles.title: Biden, Macron to discuss Israel and Ukraine in pomp-filled state visit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hours after being rescued from eight months captivity in Gaza, freed hostage Noa Argamani arrived at a hospital in Tel Aviv to see her terminally ill mother.
articles.title: Israeli hostage Noa Argamani freed in time to see her terminally ill mother

articles.author: Stoyan Nenov
articles.description: Bulgarians head to the polls on Sunday for their sixth parliamentary election in three years, but analysts say the vote is unlikely to yield a stable government that can end prolonged political instability and unblock economic reforms.
articles.title: Bulgaria holds another snap election, with more instability seen ahead

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's Conservative Party, facing an election next month, on Saturday announced details of its plan to tighten sickness benefit rules, which it said would eventually save 12 billion pounds ($15.3 billion) a year.
articles.title: UK's Conservatives promise 12 billion-pound sickness benefit savings

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The assault took place in a square in the city center when a man walked up to the prime minister and hit her. Mette Frederiksen's office said the incident had left the politician "shocked."
articles.title: Man who attacked Danish PM sentenced to 12 days in custody

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Another body was spotted off the coast of Libya on Saturday, a day after a Doctors Without Borders (MSF) rescue ship recovered the bodies of 11 migrants in the same area of the Mediterranean Sea and said it had saved more than 160 people from boats.
articles.title: Death toll rises as rescue charity spots another body in sea off Libya

articles.author: Ange Kasongo
articles.description: All 53 face charges including illegal arms possession, criminal conspiracy, terrorism and attempts to destabilize state institutions and undermine the integrity of the state, some of which risk the death penalty.
articles.title: US, British citizens among suspects on trial in Congo after thwarted coup

articles.author: Anita Komuves, Gergely Szakacs
articles.description: Hungarian opposition leader Peter Magyar called on Saturday on tens of thousands of supporters to back his party at Sunday's European Parliament election, in which Prime Minister Viktor Orban faces one of the toughest challenges of his 14-year rule.
articles.title: Orban challenger makes final push ahead of Sunday's EU vote
